file_content.text: No more. I was... unprepared....
Marvelous. Absolutely marvelous!
We could never have excavated this place without your help. Oh, we knew where the base was--but getting inside? Ghastly work.
And I should say, I'm delighted to finally meet you in person.
Do you want something from me, Leksende?
Tell me why you're here.
Do you have any idea what that "thing" is?
What was the device?
Not a one. Exciting, isn't it?
I don't have time for this, Leksende.
Not now!
What's your hurry? Sit down, and let's talk!
You see, when I was assigned to stop the Republic from finding this facility, I was intrigued by the "doomsday device."
That my superiors told me to stay away only whet my appetite. I decided to take the device for myself.
That device is too dangerous for anyone--even Czerka knows that.
That seems unwise.
As a corporation, Czerka has to be cautious with its investments. But I don't.
You really think you can control its power?
That seems unwise.
Oh, I'll give it a try.
You'd really disobey Czerka's orders?
Despite your superiors?
I'd interpret them broadly--as you can with yours, perhaps?
It all comes down to greed, doesn't it?
Typical corporate attitude.
That's one way of looking at it. Shall we continue in that vein?
Why?
I'm not sure yet. I could experiment on it, integrate it into my cybernetics, display it on the mantel... but hear me out.
Too bad I have it.
Hear me out, first.
I'm offering a very large sum of credits--as well as rescinding the "kill order" on Kamus--if you help me.
Hand over the device, and the Republic never has to know; tell Fauler you destroyed it. What do you say?
Does this answer your question?
No deal. [Destroy the device]
How could you do that! Do you know what that thing was? What it was worth?
Oh, now you've left me no choice. I'm going to have to kill you. Painfully.
It's a deal, Leksende. Don't disappoint me.
The device is yours.
I knew you could be reasonable. Your credits will be transferred before you leave the planet.
Oh--you won't mind if I take a quick peek at my toy before I leave, do you? Just a look in the box.
I advise against it.
I'd like to reach a safe distance, first.
Wait until I'm gone?
Nonsense. I'm not about to hook it back up.
Fine.
Excellent!
Ah... I think this should do nicely. The white room is open, and the rebirth has begun.
Sir?
As for us, we should be getting home to Czerka. It's been a pleasure.
You will join us now. You will be one with true majesty.
Come to me. Come close, until we are one.
I am the Imprisoned One. Few beings have the strength to resist us... but you have earned my respect. We may share words.
I have no desire to fight--but don't try anything.
All right. We'll talk.
Jedi? Czerka knows of you. You toy with the Force. My species mastered it.
I'd welcome the chance to discuss matters with you.
Excellent.
I am pleased. You are a well-mannered creature.
We can talk when you're in Republic custody.
Surrender, first.
You do not understand. I am aware of your Republic. It does not suit me.
Sure, absolutely. Let's you and I have a talk.
Um, okay.
How did you do all this?
What happened here?
So, what, we talk first, and then you attack me?
I really don't trust you.
Yes. Your body will become my skin-vessel, and you will lead me to your people... but this way, you will achieve greatness.
I am Rakata--it is the name of my people. Eons ago, our Infinite Empire ruled this world and so many others.
Yet I reached for greater majesty, and my people sealed my mind in this box as punishment. I drifted in whiteness for over twenty thousand years.
What were you trying to achieve?
Why did they do that?
What?
I sought to dance among star temples and understand dark time. In truth, I remember little.
Doesn't sound like a tragedy.
When your Czerka Corporation found my prison, I touched this world again. I created my skin-vessels and machine-hands.
I have learned of your galaxy and found it wanting. I choose to remake it, and to give birth to a new Infinite Empire.
You've hurt enough people already. No one else.
I'll never allow that.
It is not my desire to cause pain. It is, however, a necessity.
The era of your glory passed long ago.
Your time is over.
Yes. And now it will return.
We already have one Empire too many. It hasn't won the war, and neither will you.
You can't defeat the Republic.
A trivial challenge.
Uh... no.
You truly do not comprehend me. I hoped for more from your species.
By what method?
Tatooine's a pretty sad place to found an Empire.
You're not starting well.
I will transform it. I will redeem it.
You will lead our army out of the sands. This world's settlements will fall, and my skin-vessels will proceed to the stars.
The time for resistance is over. Join us now.
Leave us. Now is not your time.
